text: Earthy, cocoa, licorice, dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla aroma. Pitch black color, cant see if hazy or clear, small to medium sized brown head. Earth is my thing. Again, earthy, dark chocolate, cocoa, medium bitter with hints of sweetness. Very nice cocoa aftertaste, extremely well balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle, 0.355l. Pours opaque black color with thick creamy brown head and great lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, milk coffee and licorice. Taste starts with medium sweet rich roasted malt and chocolate, follows by licorice, grass and mild fruit, mouthfeel is mild spicy, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Classic stout with imperial taste...

Bottle thanks to wombat23. Pours virtually black from the bottle. Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate, with strong tobacco smoke. Taste is bitter with a cherry undertone that is more sour than sweet. Body is medium with soft carbonation. Overall a very solid beer, but a tick short of great.
Dark brown nearly black. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Mid-full body. More chocolate roasted malt on the palate. Delicious

Bottle, pours dark treacle brown, not much head, small off white lace. Aroma is a complex mixture of caramel, treacle, chocolate, roast, smoke, prune and raisin. Body is medium full, texture is full and viscous. Dont think this needs to come out of the fridge, added complexity as it warms. Finish has great balance, with light malt sweetness which dried. Soft to flat carbonation.

(bottle)
Aroma:dark bread,liquorice,coffee,chocolate,caramel.
Appeara color,big frothy off-white coloured head.
Taste:semi-sweet,flavour of dark chocolate,liqourice,bread,sweet roasty finish.
Palate:medium to full body,smooth texture,medium carbonation.
Overall:Very nice, surprisingly thick brew with lots of liqourice and coffee notes.
Bottle - pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma is boozy, licorice, molasses and sweet malt. Taste is roast malt up front with a dry mildly licorice malt finish.

"Ridiculous amounts of black and caramel malts" - which must have been brewed right to perfection for this only 6-percenter so packed with aroma and flavor and with such a perfect balance of roast and chocolate, bitter and sweet, licorice and coffee, and a superb mouthfeel. Oh wow!

Truly an enjoyable drink. Licorice is light and perfect at the back end. Had never heard of brewers licorice before. What a find!!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its black, it is. Small tanned lacing foam ring. Coffee aroma and nice bitter cold coffee taste. A good one. (Galveston 201705)
It might be May, but its a chilly, rainy evening here in New York City, perfect time for a good stout like this.

Not my favorite stout. It has a bit of a bit and I think you could do better than this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pi?knie i intensywnie w aromacie. Mnóstwo kakao. Troch? kawy i orzechów. Barwa czarna i niska, be?owa obr?czka. W smaku ju? nie jest tak dobrze. Pierwsze wra?enie dosy? wodniste. Wybija si? kawa, brakuje kakao. Gorzka czekolada. Goryczka czekoladowa, dobrze zbalansowane ale brakuje porz?dniejszego finiszu. Troch? sie rozczarowa?em.

Pours a dark black with a nice creamy tan head that left some beautiful lacing around the glass. The aroma is chocolate, lots of coffee, medium to heavy roasted barley malts and brown bread. The flavor is more of the same. The mouthfeel is light to medium and drinkability is quite high.

Pours black with medium beige head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, cocoa, toast, some sweetness, caramel, creamy, bitter chocolate. Taste is creamy, some oils, toast, vanilla, chocolate, back bread, cocoa, strong coffee, some smoke, light liquorice, smooth, some milk and again, coffee. Dark chocolate and morning coffee beer! Too easy to drink. Superb!
Pours black, opaque with a 2-finger tan head. Tastes of malt & coffee with a complex hop finish.

Hint of chocolate in the aroma. A deep dark toasty brown color with a none lasting tan head. The taste is coffee and a hint of chocolate and hoppy finish. Medium light body - would have liked it to be thicker. Overall a very drinkable stout - would have preferred a thicker body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black colour with a beige head. Roasted malty flavor, hints of chocolate and coffee. Roasted malty flavor with hints of coffee, chocolate and dried fruits.Bitter- Sweet finish.

Pours a very dark brown forming a substantial head. Smooth palate. Taste is lighter than I was expecting, but refreshing with very light coffee overtones. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black colour, rocky beige head, good lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, a bit of licorice and chocolate. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy bitter with notes of chocolate, licorice, coffee, heavy roasty. Roasty and ashy long bitter finish. Medium body and carbonation. Good stout, a bit too ashy.

Bought as a stand-alone single at the nearby supermarket. I pour the bottle into a tall, handled beer glass. It delivers the anticipated ink black body along with a thin tan head. Not much foam but I do get some decent lace action. It has a strong black licorice nose leading to a fine charcoal opening taste. Malt, ash and burnt pecans follow continuing with a touch of bitterness. Straightforward enough for a stout, appealing to a developed taste. One is good, move on to something else.
Bottle from Belmont station Portland. Pours fairly flat with not really a lot of head at all. Tastes of light roasted coffe and toffee. Has some lingering smoke flavor. Its ok.

Aromat dosyć rozczarowujący. Głównie nuty kawowe. W smaku też dominuje kawa. Piwo jest dosyć wodniste i jednocześnie przesadnie wysycone. Od pierwszego łyku zalega niezbyt przyjemna goryczka. 
Z czasem w aromacie zaczyna wychodzić lukrecja, ale razem z nią delikatny diacetyl i trochę alkoholu.
Spory zawód.

Zapach średnio intensywny, paloność, lukrecja, karmel, kakao, suszone owoce, kawa. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, paloność, lukrecja, kawa, gorzka czekolada. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.
Overrated beer. Nothing but a common Stout. Bought in a liquorstore in Alburquerque. Nice presence, coffee taste and nothing more.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel malt, molasses and roasted nuts. The color is pitch black and there is no head. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, caramel malt, molasses, smoke, vanilla, roasted nuts, dried fruits and lactose. A nice beer!

Served on tap at SoHo (Pitt). Black color with a brown head. Dark chocolate malt aroma. Coffee bitter malt chocolate medium heavy body, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thick rich stout pour with slight head toasty malt bitter licorice. No real hop

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas are on the faint side but varied between coffee, licorice hints of chocolate and molasses. Flavor is more earthy upfront, the coffee bitterness comes in, bits of char and dark chocolate,
