Balanced with a huge amount of smooth taste. Some licorice and slightly roasted malts with dark chocolate. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with roasted malts and some licorice. Medium/strong body with light/medium carbonation. Overall, a great product especially regarding the percentage. Could be more distinctive though.

From bottle (btld. 10/15) in porter glass. Pours oil black with brown head and aroma of roast malt with a touch of hickory smoke that reappears on the palate. Rich and tasty, even if a bit paste its prime, it has aged well

Black color. One finger thick, beige head. Roasted malt , coffee and chocolate in aroma . Roasted bitterness in taste . Smooth and balanced, no sharp angles. Classy beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from the tap into a pint glass at Churchills Pub in Savannah. The appearance is pitch black with a medium sized tan head. The aroma is roasted coffee and some black licorice. The taste follows the nose. An excellent brew.
Bells never dissapoints me.Pours pitch black with small head.Aromas of chocolate,coffee a bit roasty.Tastes of dark chocolate and coffee.full body.bittersweet.very very good.

Black pour, tan head. Nose is dark chocolate, little bitter. Bittersweet. Middle starts with smooth coffee, like a nice Kenyan blend, adds some cocco, then shows bitter charred grain. The finish is a tug of war between the bitter and the sweet. Nice beer, was great after tiramisu gelato from Frost.
Aroma is chocolatey, little roast. Pours black with a tan head. Flavor is pretty roasty, but has a nice malt flavor underneath. Nice light body, lowish carbonation. Dont get the hype

Barwa czarne, piana brązowa, szybko opadająca, pozostawiająca ślad na szkle. W zapachu aromaty czekoladowo-kawowe, skórka od chleba, orzechy, zdecydowanie przyjemnie się je wącha. W smaku gorzka czekolada, kawa, karmel, trochę słodowej kwaskowości. Bardzo fajna delikatna czekoladowa goryczka.
W aromacie uderza kawa i paloność. Piana krotkotrwała. Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzysty. Piwo z genialnie zbalansowaną goryczką i słodyczą.

I like this one quite well. Its black/brown with soapy lace. The head lasts the drink. The flavor is great. Its chocolate malt and medium bitterness. A perfectly balanced stout, if you like chocolate malt.

Piwo nieprzejrzyście czarne, piana szybko redukuje się do zera, aromat bardzo stoutowy, lekko słodki, przebija się też lukrecja, chociaż nie jest super wyraźna, jest też trochę kawy z mlekiem i kakao. Aromat nie powala, ale też nikt się raczej tego nie spodziewa. W smaku natomiast lekka słodycz, paloność, tutaj lukrecji nie czuję w ogóle, co jest dla mnie zaletą. Piwo bardziej wytrawne niż słodkie, odczucie w ustach świetne, piwo jest oleiste, gładkie, kremowe, wysycenie w ogóle nie gryzie, alkoholu nie czuć. Kalamzoo błyskawicznie znika ze szkła, jest pysznym ,lekkim stoutem idealnym w sumie na każdą okazję, aczkolwiek bez żądnych fajerwerków.

Flaska på Mbargo, Stockholm. Svart med litet beiget skum. Doftar fudge, chark och mörkrost. Mellanstor, len kropp. I smaken torra, rostade toner av kaffe men också lite sötare inslag av choklad och kola. En stabil och smakrik stout. Välgjord!

14/20 nice porter, liquorice is quite mild, mildly roasted, it's nice just not spectacular in any way 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours opaque very dark brown to black, lovely foam tan medium head which stays and laces the glass. Nose is creamy dark chocolate, syrupy chocolate, roasted malt, black coffee, little vanilla. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, black coffee, super smooth with vanilla.

Donkerzwart bier met dikke compacte mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Aroma van koffiegruis, mout, toast, gebrande noten. Gebrande, roasty mondgevoel met zware (koffie)bittere afdronk die goed blijft hangen. Ondanks relatief laag abv stout met volle smaak.

Black, great beige head. Aroma: chocolate, caramel, bread, cereal, cocoa. Medium body, light to medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Flavour: chocolate, some malty notes, dry fruits. Roasty finish, too bitter.
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a large creamy brown head. Aromas of malt, caramel, toffee, bitter roasty notes, licorice. Taste is bitter, ashy, caramel, malty, licorice, dry finish.
Smells like a chocolate malted with dark coffee & brown sugar. Bit of sour taste, darkest chocolate, sawdust, alcohol. Very drying on the pallet, Of course its dark with a dark head. Dry sour finish.
Tastes very very roasty (smells like it tastes). Very low carbonation, super smooth, nice lacing. Some caramel in the aftertaste, almost no bitterness (for a stout).
Drank with Rik in at Pivo 100 in Bratislava (after the tasting), 08-02-2017. Very good for such a low abv beer. Really nice and lots of taste.

Mély fekete szín, kicsi bézs habbal, amely gyorsan tovatűnik. Nem túl intenzív étcsokoládés illat. Étcsokoládés, pörkölt malátás, kávélikőrös íz. Az első kortyok kicsit szénsavasak, de utána szépen kisimul. Könnyen iható, ajánlom mindenkinek.

Butelka z datą: 5/18/16
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Z początku wyczuwalne nuty prażone. Na drugim planie czekolada i kawa. W tle orzechy arachidowe oraz delikatna paloność.
SMAK: Wytrawne. Posmak gorzkiej czekolady i kawy - długi. Odczucie w ustach: pełne, aksamitne, choć delikatnie szczypie w język. Alkohol, jak to w ciemnych piwach słabo wyczuwalny, a w tym przypadku jest on bardzo dobrze ukryty.
WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, niska, choć utrzymuje się do samego końca. 
OGÓLNIE: Trzy wnioski. Po pierwsze: trzeba je dobrze "ogrzać" przed degustacją. Po drugie: trzeba dać mu szanse (tyczy się aromatu) i ocenić go po pewnym czasie, ponieważ z początku piwo (tak było w moim przypadku) nie pachniało tak dobrze, jak sugerował by jego status na ratebeer. Po trzecie: smak piwa wynagradza początkowe niedostatki w zapachu, a tym samym potwierdza renomę Kalamazoo Stout.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Po przelaniu do szkła czarne, zupełnie nieprzejrzyste z drobnopęcherzykową beżową pianą, która dosyć szybko ustępuje. W aromacie dominuje kawa, czekolada, nieco popiołowych nut i karmelu. Po przełknięciu pojawia się dużo paloności, popiołu i na końcu dopiero kawa z karmelem co mi akurat bardzo odpowiada. Dosyć gładkie i kremowe. Bardzo dobre piwo reprezentujące wysoki poziom.

Bottle at home (bottled 5/18/16). Pours dark with a beige head. Aroma of light roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel. Taste is moderate bitter, light sweet, bitter roasted aftertaste. Nice and subtle.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, mocha, bread and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and roasted malts.

Overall:

 This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Great flavour, especially for its abv, that does everything right. At the same time, it feels like it misses some umpf at all times; maybe some added vanilla, chocolate, coffee or even more hops. The aroma could have been stronger as well. Great stout overall with only some minor disappointments.

Bottle from Sake no Taniguchi. Nice black pour with a low tan head, plenty of lacing. Licorice, bitter dark chocolate, and coffee aroma. Good full flavour of roasted malts, coffee, licorice, caramel, bakers chocolate. Plenty of bitterness smoothed out by the malts and nice easy carbonation, medium body for easy drinking. Delicious rich stout.

Piwo w kolorze brunatnym z obfita bezowa sredniopecherzykowa piana zostawiajaca ladny lacing na szkle. W aromacie kawa i czekolada z palonymi nutami. W smaku gladkie i pijalne, polslodkie z wysyceniem i goryczka na srednim poziomie. Fajnie ulozony i dobrze zbalansowyany stout.
Nice body, roasted hints, some coffee, a bit of chocolate. Very nice one ;)

Nice thick, dense, roasted aroma, full of coffee, chocolate notes with a touch of bread-ish notes. Pure elegance, super dignified. And then theres a taste which is even more roasted, more full of coffee. Its not that delicate and polite. Its rough, agressive. You cannot miskate it with anything else - it might be like a definition of super well made, almost classical stout. On thing I dont like about it is the carbonation, which is huge, bothers the palate to much. Except that its almost full bodied, smooth beer. In overall it really is gorgeous product!

Bottle 
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, coffee, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Flaska, Blues Pub Sundbyberg. Svart öl med ett brunt skum. Doft av mörk choklad, malt, rostade toner och lätta vaniljtoner. I smaken tillkommer lättare lakritstoner.

Bottle. Pitch black, creamy head. Dried fruits and roasted malts in aroma, some candi sugar too. In taste medium sweet, lots of dried fruits, some caramel roastiness and ash. Carbonation on higher medium level. Finish is bitter, ashy. Nice.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma: licorice and caramel, wine, vanilla, chocolate. Taste: velvety, sweetish caramel, dried fruits, chocolate and burnt barley. Very good.

Geroosterde en carameltoetsen in de neus. Zeer cleane, volle smaak, met zwarte chocolade, (lichte) hazelnoot en bitterheid. Zéér uitgebalanceerd. Niets doet vermoeden dat dit bier maar 6% alcohol bevat. In de mond een mooi ronde volle smaak met licht olie. De afdronk blijft duren, en er ontwikkelen zich nog smaakverschuivingen, lichte hop, geroosterde gerst, geroosterd brood, hout, zurige noten.
Voor een stout met 6% alcohol is dit absolute top.

Pours jet black, decent beige head. Aroma of fresh coffee, dark malt. Taste is what the style is all about, with flavors of coffee, chocolate, toasted dark malt perfectly balanced with each other. A bit sour coffee-like bitterness sweetened with a touch of subtle chocolate. Medium to full body, smooth texture, flat carbonation.

Jet black in the glass with minimal tan head. A punch of coffee powder with notes of breadcrust roastiness. Hints of cocoa and dark chocolate in the background. Taste is especially coffee cherries, but after a while it changes into roasted coffeeness. Ashy (like cocoa powder) notes still senses the tongue. Finish is dominated by dark chocolate with a gentle touch of coffee cherries. Very good.

W aromacie kompleksowe nuty stoutowe - czekolada, melano, lekka kawa czy palonosc, wsparte lukrecja, wanilia oraz orzechami. Apetyczna kompozycja. Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta z brazowa, niewielka piana, ktora szybko redukuje si? do obwodki wokol scianek. Smak wlasciwie odzwierciedla aromat, jednak dalo si? wyczuc ju? utlenienie (butelkowane w maju 2016). Wanilia czy lukrecja ju? mniej odczuwalne, natomiast pojawia sie dosc ostra goryczka slodowo- chmielowa, zaburzajaca balans. Zwlaszcza na poczatku bo po chwili kubki smakowe sie adaptuja. Srednia pelnia, umiarkowane do niskiego wysycenie i ta goryczka na finiszu. Gdyby ja troche zlagodzic... Niezle piwo, ale od pozycji top 5 w kategorii stout oczekiwalem wiecej.

Bottle. Dark brown color, huge creamy beige head, oily texture. Aroma is roasty, licorice, light vanilla, coffee and cocoa. Taste is solid malty, roasty with coffee and cocoa beans, licorice, nice hoppy, well balanced. Nice beer

pours with a brown ring. nose is sweet dark chocolate. pretty nice body with just a kick of carb. taste is dark roast coffee with a hint of fruit somewhere. really nice overall, not too sweet and not too bitter.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Black body with a thin tan head that quickly fades. Faint lacing. Aroma of coffee, charred wood and black chocolate. Flavour of bitter coffee, peanut skin and raisins. Thin to medium body with a watery texture. Soft fizz. Im surprised this is regarded so highly.

Noire à mousse brune persistante collant au verre. Nez de rôti, café, chocolat, réglisse. Bouche épaisse, ronde : café et crème vanille, chocolat noir puis apparait une douce et très longue amertume. Top (5) !
Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Black pour with a light tan head. Chocolate, coffee, licorice and toffee aroma. Flavours of Coffee, dark chocolate and smoke. Long, smoky coffee finish. Nice.

The aroma of coffee and cocoa. The flavor is coffee, sweetness, chocolate and soy. Exquisite bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Really good beer but could have been much better. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Pitch black, dark espresso head. Really smooth black chocolate, some nutty chocolate cake. The taste is rich and roasty, but in a smooth way - not acrid or ashy, with a touch of chocolate sweetness and a robust hoppy bitterness. Very good.
Black with a small off-white head. Aroma of toffee, dark chocolate and licorice. Sweet roasted flavour with licorice and a touch of ash.
Bottle @ Warpigs, Copenhagen 20170103. Roasted malty, coffee, chocolate, mid sweet, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted and bitter.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 Bottle @ Warpigs, Copenhagen 3/1-17. Roasted malty with coffee and chocolate. Body is medium, the finish is bitter and roasted with coffee and chocolate.
Tap @ Warpigs copenhagen 3/1-17. Nice and slow Stout. Only 6%. Roasted and bitter finish.
Bottle into snifter. Pours black with minimal tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, molasses and chocolate.
Schwarz mit durchschnittlicher, beiger Schaumkrone. Malzig, Röstaromen, dunkle Schokolade, Nüsse, etwas Vanille und Karamell, cremig.
Smoke, coffee and licorice on the aroma, it has a complex flavour for its abv, but the licorice gives a nice dry bitter finish.

Bottle, Brewdog Leicester. Near black with a beige head. Earthy coffee with oats and chocolate. Molasses with vanilla and creamy oak. Nutty and smoky. Hints of barbecue meat. Dark berries with herbal liquorice. Traces of salt. Good, but slightly inferior to the Hoxton Stout Ive just had

Slightly burnt toast, molasses, earth. Pours black with a thick tan head. Fair retention leaving a film on the surface and lacing on the glass. Roasted malt. Earth. Molasses. A hint of vanilla. And a hint of coffee bitterness. Medium bodied. Smooth with a dry finish. Very nice.

Bottle thx Guillaume for arranging this. A: roasty, light chocolate, a touch of coffee. App: pitch black sparing beige head. T/p: med body with light roasty finish. Velvety texture. O: Striking balance. Velvety and pleasant aroma. Something I would buy by the case if easier obtainable. Much appreciated.
355ml bottle. Black colour. Short tan head. Chocolate, dark fruits, complex. Quite a bitterness, chewy feel. Not quite what I expected, but still pretty good.

Botella 33 cl en el lupulo 16..12..2016. Color negro intenso con espuma beige lote 15857PK elaborado en 18..05..2016. Sabores suaves finos maltosos tostados convtoque amargos ligeros combinados con ligeros cacaos y especias. Bastante buena con bastante sabor para su gradación. Para repetir sin duda.

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends bottle shop. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, licorice, nuts, dark fruits, coffee cream and bread. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coffee, licorice, dark fruits, nuts and bread. Excellent stout.
Pitch black with warming sweetness. Smooth with notes of anise and lots of dark chocolate. Delicious.

Piana dość ładna, drobna, opadając dość gęsto zdobi szkło. W aromacie sporo mocnej paloności, nutka gorzkiej czekolady, jest też jakiś mniej przyjemny, szczypiorkowy akcent. W smaku jest dość mocno palone, może minimalnie przez to kwaskowate, troszkę lukrecji. Dość sporo ciała, całkiem fajna, gładka faktura, której niestety nie pozwala rozwinąć skrzydeł zbyt wysokie wysycenie. Długi, palony posmak. Przeciętniak niestety.
Aromas of fresh roasted coffee, black licorice, coffee, and dark chocolate. Taste is dark fruits, dark chocolate, espresso, charred malts, and black licorice.

Black colored, dark tan small creamy head with nice lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, some roasted malt, bit roasty acidity, burnt notes, licorice. Taste is medium sweet malt, caramel, loads of roasted malt and quite chocolatey, some licorice, bit roasty acidity, bit burnt, milky, medium+ roasted bitterness and a dry finish. Medium bodied, soft- carbonation, creamy-milky. Good but had much higher expectations...
(bottle, Pivoljub Ljubljana)

Bottle. Pitch black with a bubbly to lacy light beige head. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, biscuits, pine. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, nuts, caramel, liquorice, biscuits, really balanced. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (no mucha retención). Carbonatación imperceptible. Muy cremosa. Aroma dulzón, a caramelo, a café, a malta torrefacta, algo de chocolate... El sabor es dulce (en boca), con presencia de las maltas torrefactas y algo de chocolate; al tragar se convierte en un amargor mínimo. Lo que me interesa de verdad es el regusto a café amargo que queda en boca entre trago y trago (me parece lo más reseñable de una cerveza que, si bien es innegablemente buena, no llega a las cotas esperadas).
Bottle at home. Pours nearly black color, dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, lot of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted aftertaste.

Black color with medium brown head. Aroma: chocolate, roasty, coffee, licorice. Taste: medium sweet, bitter chocolate, espresso, little toffee. Medium oily body, soft carbonation, bitter chocolate aftertaste.
Flaske: Sortbrunøl med et fint skumhoved. Rigtig stor mundfylde med en del brændthed. Sødmen er ikke så udtalt. Rigtig flot øl men det er bare som om normale stout ikke gør det så meget for mig mere.

Bottle from Malting Pot. Black, small tan head. Aroma chocolate, coffee, malt, hazelnuts. Medium body, smooth texture. Taste moderately sweet with some background bitterness, which lingers on the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från Bishop Örebro. Svart kulör med smutsbrun skumkrona. Doft av kaffe och lite rökt torv. Halvsöt, torr kropp med lite syrlig avslutning. Smak av kaffe, mjölkchoklad, rökt torv och lite grapefrukt.
Flaska bishops Örebro. Svartbrun vätska. Doft av kakao och mörk sirap. Len smak av mjölkchoklad, kaffe och rostad malt. Mycket krämig och välbalanserad
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Zdecydowanie zbyt popiołowe, ogromne rozczarowanie...

Black colour and a very thin vanilla coloured head. Medium body and average carbonation. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Sweet flavor of coffee and bitter chocolate notes. A hint of smoke. Bitter long aftertaste.

330ml bottle. Pours black. Beige head. Coffee, sour, roasted coffee beans, hints of berries and caramel in the aroma. Tartness, sour coffee beans, coffee in the middle, slight sourness and coffee in the end. Bitterness and coffee in the aftertaste. Rather dry finish. Tart, sour palate. Mellow, silky texture. Medium balanced, low carbonated, well bslanced stout. Taste of fresh, quality coffee beans makes this brew very enjoyable.

Aroma: chocolate, licorice, roasty
Taste: light bitter, light sweet, roasty, dark chocolate

0.33 bottle.   A black color and a medium, creamy, tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, caramel, chocolate, roast, some coffee, and biscuits. Taste is bittersweet, malty, licorice and plums come in, coffee takes the prime. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a very soft carbonation. Finish introduces a lot of ash, smoke, and roasted meat. Overall the beer is decent, I would not concede it is terrific as the mean rating suggests, but it certainly has its qualities.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of burnt malts, coffee and chocolate notes. Black colour with tan head, mostly lasting. Taste is light sweet and moderate malt. Full body, oily feel, malt bitter chocolate finish.

Barwa czarna, piana mało intensywna, szybko całkowicie zanika.
Aromat średnio-intensywny, dominuje gorzka czekolada i nuty palone, na granicy z lekko kwaśnym popiołem. W tle nuty lukrecji. 
W smaku piwo jest mocno wysycone i lekko kwaskowate. Po ochłonięciu i ustaniu szczypania w język, zauważyć można gładkość piwa. Dominują słody palone, dając silnie popiołowy posmak, gorzka czekolada schodzi niestety na drugi plan. Finisz z niską goryczką, lekko ściągającą i cierpką.

Pours pitch black, oil blac actually, topped with a medium sized dark beige head, pretty lasting and creamy. Very mild roasty nose with some mild chocolate presence. A hint of bourbon later on. Taste moderately roasty with more coffee like bitterness in the finish and aftertaste, along with some gentle hoppy bittery feel, though not too intense. Creamy and thick body, quite sparkly and velvety texture. Very fine.

Black, but not completely opague. Liquorice, roasted barley and a bit of soy in the aroma, and a solid, malty, roasted flavour with moderate liquorice. Moderately sweet taste and a dry, medium bitter finish with lingering liquorice. Full body. Overall, a good, well balanced stout. It has just the right amount of liquorice. Not rich enough to deserve a higher rating. My sample was a few months past the Best By date, but that should not make that much of a difference for this kind of beer.

330ml bottle, dated 5/18/16. Smells of coffee and chocolate, some vanilla and milk scents... It all comes together into a mocha aroma.

Pours thick blackish brown with brown thick head that does not leave lacing.

Taste is dominated by dark chocolate with some delicate coffeeness that turns into a delicately bitter and rather short finish. 

Full bodied and very oily for a 6 abv stout. Often imperial stout have lighter body than this one. Very impressive. 

Overall it is a one hell of a stout. Amazingly drinkable yet with a superbly heavy body.
Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter fnish. Coffee dominating. Creamy palate.

Deep dark brown color with a small tan head. Nose is coffe, roasted malts with discrete notes of cognac. Hints of raisins and licorice. Taste is moderately bitter to sweetish. Again coffee, burnt toast, dark chocolate. Heavy body, long bittersweet finish. Great stout.
Shared 12oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, hazelnut. Excellent.

12 oz bottle. Pours a thick syrupy black with full tan head. Aromas of ashy roasted malts, dark chocolate and sweet black coffee. Flavors of dusty roasted malts, dark cocoa powder and dried coffee. Very dry. Excellent example of style.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Aroma: very roasty, chocolatey and nutty; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that lingers; Taste: classic stout flavors with additional depth and perfect tuning of roastiness and malt; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet, dry finish; Overall: great example of the style. Would get again.

Piana brązowa, drobna, obfita i trwała. Barwa czarna z brązowymi prześwitami przy dnie szkła. Aromat palony - ciemne słody, kawa po turecku, szwajcarska czekolada... W smaku dość wytrawne, palone - jest gorzka czekolada, kakao, kawa espresso, prażone ziarno... Gdzieś w tym wszystkim pojawia się delikatna karmelowa słodycz, podbita gładką i aksamitną fakturą, na końcu znów daje o sobie znać paloność w postaci popiołowej szorstkości i średniej, tytoniowej goryczce. Niskie, drobne wysycenie, olbrzymia pijalność...

Jak na lekki i pijalny stout to jest to piwo nietuzinkowe, bardziej intensywne i smaczne niż większość polskich RISów!
Bottled. Pours pitch black with off white lacing. Roast and chocolate dominate the aroma. Chocolate taste is bitter and thick with good balancing hop presence. Simply great.
Deep brown pour tan head. Scents of burnt toast, vanilla, faint chocolate. Smooth mouthfeel, dry palate,low carbonation.

Nice dark color with foam hat cappuccino color, persistent and compact. The taste is clean, with an important body, creamy, sweetened by a light molasses that is well balanced with the toasted malts and the chocolate. Great beer.

35,5cl bottle: Thanks Owen: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Almost black beer. Quick disappearing brown head.
Nose of roast, malt roast, light nutty, liquorice, ash, tobacco and some prunes...
Flavour is roasty, bitter, malt and tobacco roast, some prunes, ash, light liquorice, light coffee...
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, malty, some ash, light coffee and herbal roast.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Decent!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 355ml bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours black with good tan head. Aroma is light cocoa, molasses. Taste is quite thick and intense with molasses, liquorice, dark fruits with a good creamy body. Very good indeed.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2016 From Labirratorium. In Teku glass. Playing Magic Duels. Perfectly balanced in all aspects. Tasty and not overwhelming roastyness. Well placed noble hops. No trace of alcohol nor of the licorice announced in the label.

From bottle. Black pour with a creamy tan head. Aroma has roasted and caramel malts, light licorice maybe, chocolate, toasted malts, hints of spice like clove and cinnamon. Taste is super smooth, sweetish, light bitterness in the after taste. Super Nice creamy body and a light carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee in nose. Pours black with tan lacy foam. Taste is medium dry with dark chocolate, coffee, roastiness. Medium bitter finish, medium body, soft carbonation. Overall thats how should taste a perfect stout.
Pours a deep black with a two finger dark brown head. One of the most flavorful beers Ive ever had, but without too much alcohol or too thick a body. Delightfully quaffable

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, liquorice, bit burnt, dark chocolate, espresso, touch of vanilla. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet and bitter. Body is medium. Im not the worlds biggest fan of beers that are heavy on liquorice, but this has plenty of other flavours to enjoy such as dark chocolate and coffee.

Black, thick beige head. Aroma has licorice, roasted malt and coffee. Thick, creamy mouthfeel. Raw licorice flavour, roasted malt and notes of coffee and dark chocolate. Slightly sticky with well balanced bitterness. Very good considering the moderate ABV.

Bottle@ät, Nyköping. Pitch black color with brown head. Aroma has salted licorice, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is malty sweet with quite long fairly bitter aftertaste. Flavors of dark malt, licorice, coffee, bitter elements, vanilla. Quite oily mouth feeling. Very well balanced.
12 oz. bottle. Pours black, tan head. Aroma was dark chocolate, licorice, roasted malt, roasted coffee. Taste was creamy, bittersweet, roast coffee.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of hard bread, bitter chocolate, coffee, light raw sugar and red berries. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, bitter chocolate, raisins, light raw sugar and coffee. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Excellent stout. Balanced.

Bells Kalamazoo Stout. Espetáculo de cerveja. Prova de que não é preciso ser "imperial" pra ser foda. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at the City Cafe, Baltimore. Pours an opaque black, with a moderate tan head, which lasts well and leaves reasonable lacing. The aroma is roasty, with some smoky, meaty notes, as well as dark chocolate and coffee. Very mild herbal hops up front soon give way to a smooth, satisfying body, with plenty of bitter dark chocolate and savoury, meaty flavours. There is a bitter chocolate aftertaste. A very enjoyable stout indeed.

Small creamy tan head with low retention.
Very dark brown with burnt caramel hues colour. Opaque black appearance.
Aroma is cocoa, chocolate, prune and roasted sugar.
Taste is roasted, dry, burnt prune and burnt sugar. Quite roasted finish.
Creamy and a little astringent palate

Appearance- black, opaque, a huge pillowy light-brown head. Aroma- chocolate, fudge, treacle, caramel, dark fruit hints, liqueur coffee, liquorice, booze. Taste- roast malt, burnt toast, espresso coffee, extremely long roasty smoky finish, vanilla hints, burnt treacle, more roast malt. Smooth and sticky mouthfeel. A lovely stout.
Bottle. Black poured with a small tan head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is roasted malt and chocolate. A little thick on the tongue.

Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, weak vanilla and dry cocoa. Taste is roasted and dry with notes of dark roasted malts, liquorice, dry cocoa, dark chocolate, slight bitter hops and coffee. A rather high carp and a medium mouthfeel compared to the low abv and all.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Kalamazoo Stout by Bells Brewery at Hostal Plaza De GoyaAromat slodko waniliowo kawowo czekoladowy. W ustach w pol drogi miedzy slodkoscia i wytrawnoscia o dziwo. Srednio ciala, gladkie, sporo co2Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

duft ristet malt chokolade lidt svag kaffe kant sødlig 
smag ristet malt en smule bitter brændt ristet malt smag mørk bitter chokolade

Bottle - Pours black, tan head. Gives off an aroma of dark roasted grain almost like scorched bread or pancakes, medium roast coffee, and bakers chocolate. Similar flavors, but a slight tartness and a hint of smoke. Hops end, with burnt chocolate aftertaste.
330 ml bottle from Mikkeller Beer Club. Black with tanned head. Chcocolate, molasses, liquorice and roasted malt. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation. Medium bodied.

33cl bottle from Beer Gonzo. It pours a pitch black color with a beige creamy head. Aroma is roasty and tangy with notes of dark chocolate, coffee beans and tangy red berries. Taste is also dry and roasted with light tangy fruity notes, more cocoa and coffee beans. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; Sarkys 4K beer, dark brown pour with a thin tan head, aroma has chocolate and some roast, taste has roast malts, some sweet chocolate, some dark fruits, smoke, hint of vanilla.

My 4000th beer thanks once again to Richthevillan, cheers Rich. Black beer with medium mocha head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted malts and a little vanilla. Taste is milk chocolate, a hint of licorice, roasted malts, dark fruit and a little vanilla. Medium bodied. Excellent stout.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle @ home. Pitch black pour with a fluffy tan head. Tons of licorice root, licorice, roast, robust, some dark sweet malts. Straight up tasty!

Bottle. Reddish black body with brown fast disappearing head. Aroma is vanilla roasted malts caramel dried fruits and hints of ash. Taste is nearly the same but with more roasted malts and some hints of alcohol. Aftertaste is nice bitter slightly balanced by some sweetness. Nice one.
A: Pitch black with a one finger, thick brown head. N: Rye bread, some ash, liqourice, chocolate, coffee T: Coffee, ash, liqourice O: Quite nice...
Bottle at 100 piv. Black colour, beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee, some caramel. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, caramel, dry, somewhat sour roastiness, bitter. Roasty bitter aftertaste. Not bad.

Bottle at a tasting. Lots and lots of roast. Quite clean dark flavour, but maybe too much - coffeeish and burnt. Very dry, thin bodied. Drinkable but no masterpiece IMO. Lacking body, complexity, intensity, balance. Good beer, definitely not great.
Bottle from 100 piv. Dark brown color with medium tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, light coffee, caramel. Taste, coffee, roasted malt, cocoa beans, plums, chocolate. Enjoyable, tasty beer.

341ml bottle shared with brother, thanks for buying. Aroma: extremely roasted malt, light smokiness, light chocolate. App: pitch black with small brown head, ok retention, good lacing. Taste and palate: medium to full body, creamy, light to moderate bitter finish. Overall: more British than I thought. Surprised especially just after this Luscious. Not as much British but not far. The roastiness is more present though in Luscious. Easy to drink

Uit de fles geschonken. Mooie zwarte stout met mooie schuimkraag. Aromas van geroosterde mout, drop en stroop. Dit komt ook in de smaak terug. De dropsmaak is aanwezig maar niet overheersend. Verder een heerlijke smaakvolle stout, zacht bitter met een heerlijke afdronk.

33cl bottle. Deep coffee with dark chocolate, some little ash, nuts and molasses. Smooth mouth feel. The beer is roasted and semi dry with roasted bitterness. Its very smooth and rich coffee flavor. Extremely drinkable. Almost a quench thirster.
Dark; retains a bit of light brown head. Nose big on coffee, dark toffee, molasses. Medium body, smooth. Licqorice is there in taste but could more prominent. Lots of caramel.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roasted, meaty, chocolate, sugary, taste is sugary, roasted, toffee, chocolate, liquorice.

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a black body with a medium creamy off-white head. Nose is caramel, licorice, leather, grains and hints of chocolate and dark malts. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, grains and hints of burnt sugar, brown bread and leather. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Nice enough stout, but considering its high rating I dont really feel it bringing anything new to the table.

Bottle. 
Pitch black pour, small tan head. 
Sweet malty nose, taste sweet and balanced, with a subtle hint of licorice. 
Full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle.Black colour with large creamy beige head.Aroma is roasted and creamy with flavor of licorice and mild hops,nice with good full body and by only 6% is really good with strong licorice flavor and easy to drink.
Bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Rich aroma of coffee, licorice, dark chocolate. Full body, quite flat, bitter finish. Flavour is umami, sweet and a little bitter. Lovely.

Almost completely black colour, light brown head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, licorice, dark chocolate. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, roasty flavour. Light to medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.

Poured from the bottle into a pint glass to drink. The aroma featured roasty caramel and toffee malt, with cereal, earthy, and oat tones. Its taste was a blend of caramel, toffee, some chocolate and oats with a slightly bitter note. The body was rich and somewhat creamy with good life and carbonation. Excellent stout.
Bottle 33 cl @ Cervezorama, Spain. Very dark colour, hazelnut foam. Strong coffee flavour and taste. Very good beer.

Aroma of smoked malts and molasses, pours a dark brown almost black color with a thin brain head. A very Guiness like taste, dry smokey malt taste with a medium body hints of water and a bitter dry finish. A vastly over rated beer.

Bottle 35,5cl
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate, coffee.

Pours a very dark brown or black color. Very thick almost clumpy brown head, about two fingers. Good retention, good lacing.Aroma is medium roasted malts. Smoky, light coffee. Simple, but nice.Taste is smooth and creamy. Light coffee, some decent roasted malts. Maybe a little licorice. Tasting some light chocolate and caramel. Theres a touch of bitterness.Mouthfeel is medium bodied, not as thick and heavy you would think. It is smooth and creamy. It finishes dry..Overall, its a good stout. Its not a great stout. I wouldnt hesitate to buy it again. I recommend it. Bells is new to my area, and Im eager to try more and more of their stuff. Good stout!
Bottle at home, 22nd July 16. Pours slick and black. Aroma is roasty, liquorice, dark chocolate. Taste is liquorice, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Smooth and drinkable, light palate. Quite nice

I may have just had the best beer Ive ever tasted!!! The 4.8 is a perfect score on the chance I ever taste something best! Just an awesome stout, small head, and no bitter aftertaste at all...which I find on most stouts.

Kalamazoo Stout has a medium, beige head, a dark brown appearance, with standard brown on the edges, as light hits it, and moderate lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweet brown bread and creamy malt, and the taste is of sweet brown bread, malt, cafe au lait, maybe some background licorice, and low-level bitterness. No char, really. Mouthfeel is low medium, and Kalamazoo Stout finishes medium dry. RJT
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Its a pretty good stout. Simple flavors and licoricey. Medium bitter body with some light sour notes. Finishes surprisingly smooth.
4 oz pour on draft at Spacebar. Black with tan head. Aromas of dark chocolate, light roast. Tastes of dark and milk chocolate, cocoa, light licorice. Medium body with a dry finish.

0.355l bottle. Pitch black body, light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, leather and some floral hops. Taste of caramel, chocolate, coffee, leather and floral hops. Both the aroma and the taste are very characteristic, based on those I would definitely think this is an imperial stout. Kind of weird that its only 6%.

sample from bottle, poured a dark brown to black colour with a small beige head on top. nose of sweet roasted malts, dark chocolate, toffe, fudgie, light coffee notice, more mocha. taste of sticky caramel, roast, and sweet dry chocolate. this is thick for the 6abv. very nice

Mörk nästan svart. Lakrits och rostad malt i doft. Smaken är lättare än vad trodde med lite choklad och lakrits.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle. Black, with a thin brown head. Roasted malty aroma with sweet chocolate, coffee and notes of liquorice. The flavour is roasted malty, with liquorice, coffee and chocolate. Lingering, ashy, roasted finish. Tasty and balanced.

21.06.2016, 12 oz bottle @ home
Nice light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and dry roasted, dark malts, dark sugar, chocolate, caramel, coffee, salty licorice, minerals, nuts, toast. Taste is slightly dry and burnt, dark malts, burnt grain, burnt toast, minerals, sour coffee, grass, weeds. Medium bitterness, slightly burnt and watery mouthfeel. Very nice aroma...

Sampled at the June THT.
Thn tan head. Clear black our. A lovely stout.. Really god

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Bottle at THT. Almost black with beige head. Roasted malts, cocoa beans, light coffee, soft chalk and minerals, some fudge. Light sweet and medium bitter. Under medium bodied with a bit dry feel.

Black color with tan head. Aroma has really nice chocolate, fudge and coffee with some roasted malts on top. Taste follows with chocolate, roasted coffee and dark malts. Body is full and has a really smooth mouthfeel. Overall its a really tasty, smooth stout, especially for its ABV.
From a 65 cl bottle. Black with beige head. Pretty sharp roasted malt aroma, some coffee and liquorice. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

Its pretty easy to see why Kalamazoo Stout has become the beer that it has. It pours totally black with a rocky, creamy head. Lots of lacing as the beer level goes down. Coffee, licorice, and charred malt aromas - definitely rich. Chocolate, toasted cream, and bitter, darkened chocolate flavors. This is a thick, hearty brew for sure. Even at the relatively modest 6%, its a sipper. Delicious. Gorgeous. Classic.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Thin white beige head. Medium bitterness, low sweetness. Medium thin body. Aroma is coffee, nutty, chocolate, hops, coffee, liquorice, cacao. This is pretty good but I was expecting even better.

How : bottle Appearance : almost black with a nice medium sized khaki head. Aroma : coffee, milk chocolate, cocoa powder, dark caramel , some wood notes and fudge. Palate : medium to full body, smooth carbonation. Nice sweet aftertaste.

355ml bottle from The Perfect Pour. Pours pitch black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, hints of toffee. Taste is malt, licorice, toffee, chocolate, with a strong licorice finish. Not really sweet, and only a little bitter, but flavorful nonetheless. Thick and a little sticky, but also smooth. Fantastic.

Pours deep black with thick brown head. Nose is roasted malts and licorice. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, licorice and dark chocolate. Low carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Long roasty finish. Great stout.

0.355 l bottle from Saveur Bière, bottled in January 2016. Pitch black with a medium large, stable, dense, light brown head. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, toasted nuts and hints of raisins. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty taste of dark chocolate, coffee powder, licorice and some vanilla, followed by a medium long, medium roasty-bitter finish. Medium to full body, fairly creamy mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Superbly balanced, quite intense and really good body for that abv. Maybe not that complex, but very tasty and round. Good!

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 0,33l bottle at home shared with gf. Bottled 01/27/2016. black color, small dark coffee-colored head. smells of cocoa, vanilla, spices, coffee, overall nice smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of coffee, nice roast, bitter chocolate, spices, very light vanilla, cocoa powder, earthy. finishes with light sweetness and some roast and notes of cocoa, bitter chocolate and coffee. quite good one, not the best stout i ever head but still very enjoyable.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark beer with minimal brown head. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and lactose. Taste is bittersweet with moderate carbonation. Medium bodied, smooth and creamy. Black coffee aftertaste with hints of cream.

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque dark brown with a creamy brown head. Sourish aromas of roasted malts, dried fruits, molasses. Medium to robust bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Smooth and oily. Medium to low sweet, with medium bitterness and a slight sourness. Deep roasted character into a sourish finish. Unusual, but quite pleasant.

355ml bottle. Super lively pour. Great appearance, space black with off white head. Taste is smokey liquorice. Good stout, looking for some more chocolate, all round a good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop. Pours pitch black with creamy, beige head. Grainy aroma with chocolate, coffee, vanilla and some chalk. Taste is slightly bitter with coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice and some earthy notes. Long, slightly bitter coffee finish.

0,33l bottle. Thick black colour with slowly shrinking beutiful and fomay surprisingly brown head. Aroma: Coffee, roasted toast, vanilia,almond and other nuts, Very complex. Taste: Very-very smooth texture. Well balanced sweet/sour/bitter taste, than slowly the bitter wins the fight. Warming feel. The coffee taste dominates but has so many notes. Medium/full bodied with soft carbonation. Long and intense bitter finish. This is an amazing beer one of the best of its style.

Bottle. Black with a medium sized light brown head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Nose has roasted malt, vanilla, chalk, dust. Flavour follows with roasted malt, vanilla, chalk, light iron, bark, earth. Medium body, fine carbonation, some sweetness, long bitter and dry finish with roasted malt. Good.
Black with a creamy tan head. Dark roasted coffee & espresso aroma. Nice roasted coffee and dark Chocalate flavor.

355 ml bottle, pkgd 01/27/16, from Saveur Bière. Thanks to Werckmeister!
Pitch black body, with a small, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of espresso, liquorice, wood, soy sauce, ash, cocoa, dark chocolate, dark fruits.
Taste follows this, but not fully as rich as the nose.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty-bitter, dry, wooden, with liquorice, coffee, soy sauce, ash, some cocoa.

Very nice, although I was expecting a bit more. The nose is really big for the ABV, taste is a bit more one-dimensional, although still enjoyable and very well balanced. Overall not among my favourite Stouts, but a really good one I would drink again.
almost black colour, huge creamy beige head; aroma and taste of roastedness, dark chocolate, roasted sunflower seed, some coffee and hints of herbal liqueur notes; good stout
Nagy, tartós, tömör, barna hab, fekete szín. Feketecsokis illat. Kávés, feketecsokis, aszaltgyümölcsös ízek. Testes, kissé olajos sör, alacsony szénsavtartalommal.

Botella, @Irreale, Madrid, 07/05/2016. 
Color negro, espuma beige, sabor torrefacto, regaliz, final seco, cuerpo medio.
Surprisingly full bodied for such a low ABV, very balanced, distinct dark choco character, coffee, rich roast maltiness, caramel, hazelnuts. Moderate sweetness with light bitterness. Very nice
Super robust roast coffee nose. Dry, rich chocolate and coffee. Damn dry and with a real bitterness to it. I could drink a lot of it.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Pours black with an impressively thick light-brown head that is in no hurry to go away. Smells rich and roasty. A great start, but unfortunately, the taste is a bit more bitter than I like, and it feels rather thin in the mouth for a stout. Despite the thin mouth feel, it is smooth going down. It did get better as it warmed a little. Id probably give this brew another shot someday, but I was really hoping for more.

Pours black with high latte brown head
Aromas of dark fruits, dark malts, coffee, molasses, chocolate
Taste has caramel, black malts, coffee, liqourize, chocolate, dark fruits
Very well balanced stout given the abv level. Nice balance between caramel, and dark maltyness.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu snifteriin sysimustana, noin 1,5 sormen paksuisella melko tiiviillä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on vahvaa kahvista paahteisuutta, jopa tupakkaa. Myös lakritsia löytyy hyvin reilusti, lievemmin löytyy suklaata ja maamaisuutta. Maussa lakritsi iskee aivan alussa, sitten kahvisuus valtaa alaa ja dominoi loppua kohti. Jotain marjaisuutta ja karheaa puumaisuutta löytyy tumman suklaan lisäksi. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen(+), melko maitoinen, jonkin verran humaloitu ja hieman hyökkäävä. Laadukas ja hyvin tyylinmukainen stout, hyvin kahvinen tapaus. Tasapainoa löytyy ja kahvisuus ei niin kovasti haittaa kuin yleensä.
From a bottle. Beautiful beige head which lasts for a while. The beer is probably too cold when served. Coffee, caramel and some vanilla.
Negro con reflejos rubí y espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate, avellana, tostados ligeros. Cuerpo medio- bajo, sabor achocolatado y avellana con final tostado suave.

Bottle at home. Black colour with a huge, long-lasting brown head. Nose is coffee with some sourness. Taste is medium to high bitterness, with some sourness in the end. Coffee aftertaste. Low carbonation, but very smooth. Nice brew, cant really feel the licorice.
Dark brown, almost black, with rich creamy brown head. Bit sweet and smoky aroma. Hoppy biteness followd by remarkable roasted grain notes, some sweetness around. Moderate roasted bitter aftetaste.

pours black color, clear, with creamy light brown - beige, stable head.
visually low carbonation. Aroma: dominate dark roasted malt aroma, which takes on coffee, chocolate, cocoa powder, supported with licorice and dark fruits.
Flavor: similar to aroma - intense roasted dark malts flavor, supported with licorice, molasses and hop flavors, which takes on some dark fruits/citruses. Hop bitteness is medium and steps forward in finish. finish is slightly roasted, bitter. Body is medium, carbonation is low, texture is velvety smooth.

Pint pour, deep darkest brown to black with amber-khaki head. Nose is full of rich dark roasted coffee and toasty malts with lighter caramel notes in the background. Flavor follows, loads of coffee up front and in the finish, plenty of bitter chocolate. Toasty toasty, rootenest tootenest killer stout. 19052015

A black beer, a head is medium and light brown. Aroma is great, strong liquirice and dark chocolate, some sourness of milk and roastiness. Taste has liquirice, coffee, some bitterness in the end. Medium bodied, smooth. The body could be strenghten but nothing wrong in this either. The great beer which is dominated by tasteful liquirice and chocolate.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 4-ty najlepszy Stout na świecie. 

Stout warzony z dodatkiem lukrecji. 

Piwo ma nieprzejrzyście czarny kolor.
Piana jest beżowa, czapowata, drobnooczkowa i wylewa się ze szkła.
Każdy łyk powoduje rysowanie krążka na ściankach.
W aromacie słodka czekolada, karmel, lukrecja i odrobina wanilii.
W kontrze do tej słodyczy nos atakuje subtelna paloność.
W smaku początek jest słodki z wyżej wymienionymi składnikami.
Goryczka średnia, niezalegająca, a sam finsz o dziwo wytrawny, długi z orzechowym posmakiem na podniebieniu.
Na ostatniej prostej pojawia się również kawa.
Niskie wysycenie.
Gęsta, kremowa faktura.
Po dodatku lukrecji spodziewałem się słodkiego, zaklejającego usta Stouta, tymczasem sama końcówka była mocno wytrawna.
Bardzo dobre piwo.
Bells Brew trzyma bardzo wysoki poziom.
Ich ciemne piwa zaskakują swoim balansem, kremową fakturą i gładkością.
Jeżeli gdziekolwiek, kiedykolwiek zobaczycie jakiegoś Stouta z ich browaru - bierzcie w ciemno - satysfakcja gwarantowana!
The color is truly opaque. A brilliant complex, dark aroma. Just a touch too bitter for my taste on the finish, but that is emblematic of the American Stout style.

330ml bottle (mart). Very dark brown color. Small size, bubbly tan head, stays. Cocoa powder, roast, chocolate, roast and walnuts in aroma. Roast, chocolate, nutty, crumbly cake in taste. Sweet and crumbly chocolate cake in aftertaste. Hopping is well done. Nice mouthfeel. Excellent brew. Extra points for normal level of alcohol.

(355ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Apr 21 2016) Pours dark brown with a medium tan head and spotty lace. Aroma is fairly hard-roasted malts, semi-sweet black licorice, a bit of toffee, moderate levels of coffee and darker chocolate, rather dry. Palate again on the drier side with some toffee and caramel for sweetness, along with a reasonable amount of black licorice, coffee grounds, chocolate, roasted and somewhat burnt grains and cacao bitterness. Finish is dry and dusty with lingering licorice and fairly burnt malt. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Very nice stout for the alcohol content, but maybe not quite as intense as it could be even then.

355ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut!
Lovely chocolatey roasted malts in the aroma, says flavoursome, but in a lovely mellow way. More chocolatety malts in the taste, but something special happens when it hits your tongue - wave after wave of roasty-but-milky grains, very nice bitter hops too, burnt in places, but not in a harsh way. Respect for doing such a tasty beer at this strength. Nice full palate, but not heavy. Finish is burnt, chocolatey, and bitterly hopped. Yes, this is beer.
Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma is roast, oats, coffee, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, licorice, malt, coffee, oats. Overall: great brew.

Bottle shared by Mart. Brown beer, tan head. Nose is roast, dry notes and coffee. Nicely mellow. Flavor is, again, mellow, coffee, caramel. Finishes with smooth roasty bitterness, lingering roasty acidity. Very flavorful and smooth, not a 12 percent sledgehammer in your face, but still full of flavor. Very nice.

33cl bottle. Pitch black pour with a tall tan head with good retention. Smells of roasted malts, milk chocolate and a bit of coffee. Roasty and bitter, with notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee beans, licorice and a bit of cocoa. Medium body with medium carbonation,

April 20, 2016. Bottle, bottled January 27, 2016. 
Black with a large creamy tan head, Aroma is roasted malt, salty and sweet licorice, coffee, toffee, notes of dark chocolate, hints of vanilla and ash. Taste is light sweet, soft medium roasted bitterness. Finish is lasting dry roasted bitterness with cocoa, some ash notes with a very light chalky note, some salty soy and licorice notes, light sweetness of toffee and licorice. Light to medium bodied, soft small bubble carbonation. 
Solid stout, slightly too thin finish with just a bit too much dry bitterness, I would some more balancing malty sweetness.

Pours matte black with a low mocha head. Aromas of coffee, roasted malts, roasted nuts, vanilla, dark chocolate, roasted nuts. Taste is roasted notes, chocolate tones and some nice complementary bitterness. Mouthfeel is light to medium and quite dry with medium carbonation.

Bottle from VilleValla Pub. Black with beige head. Aroma of coffee, rostad malts. Taste of coffee, roasted malts, dark malts, hints of liqorice with a dry finish. One of the best stouts for the alcohol content Ive had.

Bottle at bishops folkis.
Black with some red tints, big tanned head.
Very nice roasted aroma with cocoa powder and licorice root, vague fruitiness.
Dry and dusty malty roasted with coffee and licorice. Some vague fruitiness.
Fairly dry and bitter.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
Very nice dusty roasted aroma. A bit light and dry.
Nice.

(35 cl bottle from Mikkeller Bottleshop; Pkd on 27/01/16) Poured at fridge temperature into a Maisel & Friends footed tulip reveals a pitch black body with a two finger toffee head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of toffee and coffee. Very smooth and pleasant. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and a roasted, lingering finish. Flavour is well balanced with the roasted notes taking a dominant role and them being able to play the part without being too ascerbic or too bland. Drinkable, tasty, well-composed and well-balanced but in my view somewhat par for the course in this day and age - akin to a Samuel Smith Imperial Stout.

12oz bottle pours black brown with a finger of offwhite head. Nose and taste have nutty bitter chocolate, fruity coffee bean, hints of licorice and cream, dark crust, dark grain, light spice, medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness and mostly dry.
Pours black, beige head. Heavily roasted malt aroma. Flavor of chocolate and coffee. Really terrific low abv stout. Right up there with some of the imperials, but sessionable. Thanks Lorene!

Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, and hints of vanilla. Moderate carbonation. Strong dark chocolate and coffee flavors. Undertones of licorice. Nice overall.

Aroma: molasses, marmalade, dark fruits, liquorice. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: dark, toasted malts, dark fruits, ripe plums, alcohol, sweet, fresh fruit. Overall: nice Stout, great palate. Bottle from Rattle n Hum, Manhattan.

HAving a little flight at home with sierra nevada stout and balast point american stout. All pretty good but a little bit diffrent. This one has a lot of roasty malt character with a great smooth creamy mouthfeel. Very good.

Bottle.

A- Subtle licorice, subtle coffee, subtle cocoa, roasty.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Roasty, dry, black licorice, subtle coffee, bakers cocoa.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, roasty finish.

O- This is one of those stouts that is just good plain and simple. No crazy flavors, not in your face, just a simple and tasty stout. While I do often prefer those crazy flavors and big stouts, I enjoyed this one a lot.
355 ml bottle at home. Black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, licorice, coffee, caramel. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily silky body with soft carbonation.

(Bells Kalamazoo Stout) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a big snifter, ABV 6%
Black coloured body, two full fingers of thick, brown head on top, with great retention.
Aroma of milky chocolate, olive pit, light cocoa, more chocolate as it warms up.
Taste of dark and milky chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, coal on the finish.
Medium body, soft carbonation. 
Very good, quality beer, lots of flavour and not bad of a body for that ABV.

12 oz Bottle from Growlers to Go The stout poured an inky black with a small tan head and some modest lacing. I think is was too cold. The aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, prunes and licorice are detected. Nice beginning. The medium body stout has a soft carbonation. The flavors are most enjoyable. More licorice, bitter chocolate and dried fruits. The stout finishes with some sweetness of chocolate with the coarseness of burnt malts.
Tap at Ginger Man, New York. Colour is black with brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Watery but drinkable.
From a bottle. Love the coffee and lingering bitter chocolate flavours, super smooth, amazing stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Smell of roasted cofee, medicine stock, malt, oyster. come in very deep dark, brown top, tan crown, taste of toasty malt, coffee, just almost full body, thick and slightly slimy, very good stout from Bell?s, but I prefer other Bell?s stouts though.
Pour dark, like an evil dark. About an inch of tan head. Good body. Thick. Tastes of chocolate, malts, sweetness, and caramel. The licorice is a nice accompaniment rather that the star of the show.

From the bottle the pour is very dark chocolate in color, the head is nut brown and lingers on the beer, the aroma is roasted oats with caramel and toffee notes in the back of the nose, the taste is smokey with a hints of caramelized sugars in the finish. Great stout.
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen on 16 December. Pours black with an off white head. Aroma of liquorice. Dry chocolate finish.
Appearance is deep black. Aroma is sweet roasted malt. Taste is a nice roasted malt with hints of coffee and chocolate. Overall a very good stout.

Just a great stout. Pours perfectly - nice lingering brown head that lasts the whole beer. Lush, full mouth feel. Lots of delicious dark roast, but not very bitter - more milk chocolate than cocoa. Some anise flavor, too. Overall great beer.

12oz bottle. WOW. Pour was almost perfect. Dark, dark and more dark. Head is thick, foamy and lasted FOREVER. Glass was empty, and beer still had foamy head. Roast everything-coffee, malt, espresso, chocolate. A little bit of molasses and licorice. Slight bitterness on the finish. Not enough to worry about..Not much wrong with this beer. Maybe a little more on the abv, but thats a minor complaint. Wish I had a second bottle
A good stout full of flavor. A little on the mild side. I'd like a bit more kick or flavor.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and burnt toffee. Taste is sweet chocolate malt toffee up front with a chocolate burnt marshmallow finish. I like it!
Tap at ginger man, ny. Black color, brown head. Aroma jas lots of roastiness, some coffee. Balanced roasty body, chocolate notes, espresso.

Roasty, toasty espresso everywhere! Ink black color with a tan head that pretty much dissipates rather quickly. The color is truly opaque. A brilliant complex, dark aroma. Just a touch too bitter for my taste on the finish, but that is emblematic of the American Stout style. Its delicious if your down with the bitterness.

Pours basically black, very opaque, with a lovely creamy head. Smells of dark roasted coffee and some dark mollasses/licorice. Taste is extremely smooth, creamy, and pleasant, with notes of coffee, molaasses, black licorice - all very full bodied and creamy smooth. Barely recognizable hops. Very friendly beer and Id say a huge success. Personally, I find a part of me wishing it was more complex, but thats really my own beer preferences. Excellently brewed beer.

Aroma: roasty, chocolate, molasses, coffee
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Thanks to Matt for the bottle! Black pour. Roasty coffee and bittersweet chocolate. Very, very full mouthfeel. Slightly lactic after. Big. Really tasty.
Very good. Bitter coffee. Long dry finish. Absolutely delicious............

Pours near black with a frothy brown head. Nose is fresh coffee and cream. Flavor is a little more subdued but similar, with a relatively thin feel on the front but good roasted barley on the back side.
Pours black and opaque with a nice foamy head. Pretty simple ashy malt aroma, not as nuanced as I was hoping. Bitter start to finish. Pleasant creamy palate. Very good, but not memorable.

It tastes like black licorice, but not in a way that makes you say, "Aw, shit...no one likes black licorice." Its good. It pours with a big head, so do so as slowly as you can, but its a fun beer to drink.

Six pack. On the dry side, very roasty. Tastes like coffee with a hint of molasses. Im not sold on the claim about ridiculous amounts of specialty grains. Maybe Ive become overly familiar with non-Imperial stouts, but this didnt taste as rich as Id have liked.
Bottle. Black colour with brown head. Chocolate, malt and roasted aroma. Sweet, chocolate, malt, caramel, vanilla, roasted taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle from K&L in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, burnt caramel, some dark chocolate, vanilla and maybe some cherries in there. Taste is more coffee and dark chocolate with a great balance of tang, smooth and bitter. A rock steady stout.
Bottle. Very dark brown almost black. Medium head with a tan color. Aroma is toasted grains, burnt toast and coffee. Taste is strong coffee with hints of chocolate and caramel.

12 oz bottle poured and split at a tasting. Thanks Tcon for sharing this one. From notes. Pours a muddy dark brown color with a thin patchy head. Thick body, but flavor on the moderate side, with coffee, caramel, and a hint of vanilla. Dry coffee finish. Very tasty for sure. Fun to try this. Ive missed out on it for years.

A basic stout.. Good but since rating and tasting all these different beers I have found better.

So good as a staple. Not as a favorite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black pour with a one finger khaki head recedes slowly and clings to the glass. Nose is coffee, chocolate, licorice, molasses, hint of vanilla, floral hops, smoke and some dark fruit. Flavour is medium bitter coffee and chocolate with some earthy hops and some sweet molasses for balance and a smokiness that dds some interest. Full creamy body with soft carbonation. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Pours black with a mocha colored head. Aroma is roasted smokey malt with chocolate and licorice. Flavor is dark chocolate with roasted malt and smokiness. Finishes with a light licorice flavor and dark roasted malt.

28/IX/15 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ the turd (di)mansion (home) - BB: n/a, bottled: XI/21/13 (2015-1435) 
Clear dark brown beer, big creamy irregular beige head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: dusty, sweet, dried fruits, coffee, malts, toast. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sourish, coffee, dark chocolate, bit malty, cocoa powder, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: very roasted, charcoal, bitter hops, some dried fruits, bit grassy, dark fruits. Nice one!

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 On tap, poured into a nonic glass. The aroma is a defined licorice and coffee blend with roasted grain and a light berry note. The beer is dark, nearly opaque, brown black hue with a tan, dense foam head that leaves a messy lace and has good retention. The taste is a smokey, medium sweet and medium light bitter. The creamy and smooth beer has a foamy carbonation and a medium full body with smokey notes of a fruit forward coffee with caramel notes, and a light licorice. The finish is smooth molasses with a stronger smokey and roasted grain / bread crust character, and chocolate notes leaving an aftertaste of strong espresso beans.

355ml bottle. Darkest brwon, quasi black colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, almost fully lasting, moderately lacing, beige to tan head. Roasty, dark malty aroma, notes of dark chocolate, hints of liquorice, molasses, a touch of burnt caramel. Taste is moderately sweet dark malty, slightly roasty, notes of dark chocolate, caramel, molasses, some liquorice; smooth and soft, creamy palate. Rich and intense, thereby very drinkable, superbly balanced - could easily become an addictive drug if better available over here.

Bottle. Near black in color with a brown head. Chocolate and roasted coffee notes in aroma with some additional hints of vanilla and slightly burnt wood. Dark and pleasant. Chocolate and coffee notes in taste as well. Smooth one too. Roasted and light chocolate bitter notes in finish. A real treat.

Bottle from Beer Cartel 301015. Everything good about stout is contained in this beer. Thick black colour, dense head of light brown foam, aromas that fill the nose and flavours that make your eyes roll back in your head.

Bottle at home. Pitch black colored, beige creamy head that nicely stays. Rich nose and taste with chocolate and mocha, milky coffee, nice floral hoppy backbone, liquorice in the distance; light bitterness in the finish. Finish lingers nicely, with coffee and chocolate maltiness. Velvety smooth mouthfeel, good body, low carbonation. Very well balanced, rich flavours considering the low alcohol grade.

Black with a foamy light tan head. Rich dark aroma with some roasted dark grains and a fair bit of dark chocolate, slightly bitter and earthy but also slightly toasty and biscuity. Rich flavor with a full body, featuring roast and dark chocolate, a wee bit of earthy biscuit, slight licorice, and a bit of toast. Nice subtle chocolaty sweetness throughout. Really complex and well balanced. Dark and sumptuous without being boozy.
Zwart bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt metaal, chocolade, mout. Smaakt geroosterd, chocolade, koffie, zacht. Nice.
Bottle shared, thanks Jonno. Rich dark chocolate, roasted malt, licorice and herbal notes, low carbonation, dry finish. Solid stuff, if not maybe a bit too classic.

Almost opaque black/brown, deep tan robust head and thick lacing. 
Clean up front, some bitterness, coffee, slight hint of licorice. 
Bitter aftertaste. 
Bottled on 9/2/15 
Consumed on 10/19/15 
$9.99/multi sixer at Wegmans Leesburg VA
Bottle. Thanks Jon! Roast, bit meaty, coffee, chocolate. Taste is good, roast, bit earthy, chocolate. Little bitterness at finish. Cant really find the liquorice.

Lock 27, Dayton, OH, draft. Very smooth and mellow and tasty. Not tobaccoy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

スタウト   
あまい、香ば&

Cant believe I havent rated this. Chocolate roasty nose. 
Looks great. Dark brown. Mid tan head. Super creamy looking. 
Taste is smooth. Nice roasted earthy note. Subtle tobacco flavor. Hops are tangebile but compliment well. 
Palate is smooth and dry. Super dry but medium full body makes this better than an Irish dry stout for me. 

This is a great beer. Drinks a lot like a robust porter. Nice roasty tobacco notes but dry metallic finish. well balanced. Easy drinking but more fulfilling than a session beer.
Right off the bat, beautiful color and cocoa puff, milk stout like aroma. Wonderful balance of bitterness & roast with sweet maltiness. Excellent brew!

Bottle @ home. Opaque pitch black color, full sized beige head that lasts for a long time and leaves fair to good lacing. Aroma is malts, moderately roasty, lightly molasses. Taste malts, dark malts, slightly liquorice, some chocolate hints, softly bitter. Smooth mouthfeel, velvety texture, soft carbonation. Nice, but not nearly as good as I had hoped it would be.

04/02/15 bottle. Pours black with a half finger, tan head that thins to a thick film. Aroma has deep notes of roasted malts, and dark chocolate. Taste is on the bitter side. Dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, toffee, and a touch of licorice at the end. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a bone dry finish. Overall very nice and drinkable. Dark chocolate and roasted malts mixed with caramel, toffee, and hints of licorice.
Bottle at tasting. Aroma of liquorice and sweet chocolate. Simple taste of drop, mild salt and gritty coffee. Just solid, again very overrated, like all Bells.

Pours dark opaque brown with a creamy cigar head that sticks around well after the beer is poured. Nose is loaded with roasty chocolate, licorice and even coffee. First drink was crazy bitter, maybe it was too cold, or maybe just the first roasty stout of the season. As it warms the mouthfeel opens up and balances the bitterness better. Solid, although not a 100 point beer.

355ml bottle from Firmabier


Deep brown colour with a light brown small head. Aroma of coffee beans, flavour of chocolate, light coffee, roasty. Good one.

Pitch black colour, kaki head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, molasses, roasted malts, toast. Light sweet malty flavour, coffee, molasses. Quite fizzy. Finish molasses, brown sugar, roasted meat, coffee. Nice stout!!(from 35.5cL bottle @ the Turd (di)Mansion. Thanks for sharing, Tim)

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2015 Poured from a bottle. Pours black with a light tan head. Smoky malt aromas dominated by notes of coffee. Full bodied with an earthy, chocolatey flavor. Some mild bitterness. Malty aftertaste.

Pours black with a khaki head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate, toast, coffee, licorice and coffee aroma. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. licorice, raisin, toast, biscuit, toffee, vanilla, molasses and light earth hop flavors. Medium full body and average carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Dark chocolate, licorice, molasses, toast and roasted malt finish.
Pours totally black with a brown head. Aroma is malt, roasty, chocolate, coffee, caramel and raisin. Taste is medium sweet leading to a roasty finish. Excellent.

From a 12 ounce bottle. Pours black. Absolutely no opacity when held to a light. Lazy carbonation with minimal head. Chocolate coffee nose. Wonderful complex flavor. Toffee, hint of caramel. Bitter aftertaste that lingers. Not something to drink a case of, but a warm welcome after I chose some less fabulous beers.

Roppant szerethető ital képe tárul elénk már a kitöltést követően, a Bells Kalamazoo stoutjának küllemét illetően egy szavunk sem lehet. Koromfekete, bézs színű habbal a tetején, krémes aromák tömkelege, már ránézésre is krémesnek ható test. Illatában a szokásos pörkölt hangulatok mind megtalálhatóak, pirított magvas, diós, mákos, nápolyis jegyek tolódnak össze hirtelen, majd pár pillanat múlva megnyugszik a levegő és sima, étcsokoládés-kávés karakterben egyesül a sziporkázó sokaság. Selymes teste a lehető legkönnyebben csúszik, s bár minden megvan benne, ami egy italt karakteres stouttá tesz, talán még a markánsabb ízektől idegenkedő, sötétebb hangulatú söröktől távolságot tartó közönség számára is szimpatikusnak hat a mesteri kifinomultság, ahogyan a faháncsos, hamus, zordabbnak tűnő mondandó efféle bájos módon kerül tálalásra. A tejszerű, krémes textúra, a gömbölyded és könnyednek ható szerkezet ideális környezetet biztosít a mélyebb tartalom kiteljesedéséhez, így lényegében észrevétlen módon esünk áldozatává a határtalan komplexitásnak, s a kiegyensúlyozottság példaértékű megnyilvánulásának. Valóban utánozhatatlanul sima a karaktere, az egyes kortyok során végig az étcsokoládés, elegánsan pörkölt hangulatok dominálnak, a rendre felbukkanó savanykás beütés ez esetben távol marad. S bár stoutok esetében szinte kivétel nélkül az "imperial" vonásokkal felruházott változatok mellett teszem le a voksom, amennyiben izgalommal teli darabok után kutatok, a Kalamazoo egyszerűségének nagyszerűsége legalább akkora élményt nyújt, mint az előbb említett típusok vadságának magával ragadó jellege.

Classic American dry stout from a brewery perhaps most renowned for its stouts, with dense, moussy, irregular, yellowish beige head and opaque black colour, only revealing its true deep mahogany hue in the end. Very roasted aroma giving off impressions of espresso and coffee grounds, salmiac, charcoal, iron but in a natural, blood kind of way, burnt wood, toasted bread, bitter chocolate, roasted meat, caramel candy, fried plantain, brambleberries, roasted peanuts. Refinedly sweetish onset of candied cherries and raisins countered by a deep, soft sourishness, very creamy and oily body with appropriately soft carbonation, slick caramelly and toasted maltiness evolving into a big, distinctly coffeeish roasted bitterness lining the mouth cavity, much more coffee-like than dark chocolate-like in this case, with the basic sourishness continuing and a meaty umami flavour adding complexity; peppery hops add further drought in the finish, along with a glow of warming alcohol, which in all stays well hidden (as it ought to be in a 6% ABV beer). Charming, heart-warming, exceptionally well-made, rounded, elegant and deeply roasted: this is a stout of technical perfection and great finesse. Righteously famous.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Nice roasted malt aroma with chocolate and coffee notes along with some oats. Taste is moderately bitter and dry on the mouth. Flavors of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, biscuits, caramel. Overall a very tasty stout, definitely one of the best I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle. Enjoyed at Los Angeles, CA. Pours a black colour with a small beige head. Aroma of roastiness, oatmeal and chocolate. Flavour of rich roastiness, vanilla, oatmeal, biscuit, mild bitterness and wholegrain cereal. Full bodied. Like a meal.

벨스 브루잉 - 칼라마주 스타우트 6% ABV 미시건에 있던 칼라마주 거리의 벨의 양조장은 처음에 칼라마주 브루어리라는 이름으로 시작했다 2006년 이름을 벨스 브루어리로 변경한다. 평범한 스타우트 맥주
